Question_1.Context: The study focuses on examining memory-dependent derivatives in a 2D transversely isotropic homogeneous magneto thermoelastic medium with two temperatures.
Question_1.Question: What is the aim of the present investigation?
Question_1.A: To analyze the stress distribution in a magneto-thermoelastic medium
Question_1.B: To study the effect of memory-dependent derivatives in a transversely isotropic medium
Question_1.C: To explore the behavior of displacement components in a homogeneous medium
Question_1.D: To investigate the temperature distribution in a magneto-thermoelastic solid
Question_1.Source: The aim of the present investigation is to examine the memory-dependent derivatives in 2D transversely isotropic homogeneous magneto thermoelastic medium with two temperatures.

Question_2.Context: The study discusses the generalized thermoelasticity models and their application in various engineering fields.
Question_2.Question: What is the wide application of magneto-thermoelasticity mentioned in the text?
Question_2.A: Studying the behavior of stress in nuclear devices
Question_2.B: Analyzing the effects of the earth's magnetic field on seismic waves
Question_2.C: Investigating the emission of electromagnetic radiations from geophysics
Question_2.D: Exploring the damping of acoustic waves in a magnetic field
Question_2.Source: Magneto-thermoelasticity deals with the relations of the magnetic field, strain and temperature. It has wide applications such as geophysics, examining the effects of the earth's magnetic field on seismic waves.

Question_3.Context: The study introduces the concept of memory-dependent derivatives and their application in thermoelastic materials.
Question_3.Question: What is the significance of the memory-dependent derivatives introduced in the study?
Question_3.A: To simplify numerical calculations in thermoelastic materials
Question_3.B: To represent memory dependence in heat conductive sense
Question_3.C: To analyze the behavior of magnetic fields in magneto-thermoelastic materials
Question_3.D: To study the effects of radiation in nuclear devices
Question_3.Source: Generalized thermoelasticity models have been further comprehensive into temporal fractional ones to express memory dependence in heat conductive sense.

Question_4.Context: The study discusses the mathematical models of electro-thermoelasticity and their application in heat conduction.
Question_4.Question: What did Ezzat et al. propose in their mathematical model of electro-thermoelasticity?
Question_4.A: A new model of heat conduction with time delay
Question_4.B: A model of stress distribution in magneto-thermoelastic materials
Question_4.C: A theory of electromagnetic radiation in nuclear devices
Question_4.D: A concept of memory-dependent derivatives in thermoelastic materials
Question_4.Source: Ezzat et al. proposed a mathematical model of electro-thermoelasticity for heat conduction with a memory-dependent derivative.

Question_5.Context: The study mentions the proposal of a new mathematical model of generalized magneto-thermo-viscoelasticity.
Question_5.Question: What did Aldawody et al. propose in their mathematical model?
Question_5.A: A new theory of stress distribution in magneto-thermoelastic materials
Question_5.B: A model of heat conduction with memory-dependent derivatives
Question_5.C: A concept of dual-phase-lag heat conduction law
Question_5.Source: Aldawody et al. proposed a new mathematical model of generalized magneto-thermo-viscoelasticity theories with memory-dependent derivatives of dual-phase-lag heat conduction law.

Question_6.Context: The study highlights the lack of research in memory-dependent derivative approach for transversely isotropic magneto-thermoelastic medium.
Question_6.Question: What is the main gap identified in the research?
Question_6.A: Lack of studies on the behavior of stress in magneto-thermoelastic materials
Question_6.B: Insufficient exploration of temperature distribution in transversely isotropic materials
Question_6.C: Limited research on memory-dependent derivative approach in magneto-thermoelastic medium
Question_6.D: Inadequate analysis of displacement components in homogeneous media
Question_6.Source: In spite of these, not much work has been carried out in memory-dependent derivative approach for transversely isotropic magneto-thermoelastic medium with two temperatures.

Question_7.Context: The study discusses the method and solution of the problem using Laplace transforms and Fourier transform technique.
Question_7.Question: What technique is adopted to estimate the nature of displacements, stresses, and temperature distributions?
Question_7.Source: In order to estimate the nature of the displacements, stresses and temperature distributions in the physical domain, an efficient approximate numerical inverse Fourier and Laplace transform technique is adopted.

Question_8.Context: The study discusses the effect of memory-dependent derivatives on the physical quantities in the magneto-thermoelastic medium.
Question_8.Question: What is the motivation for introducing the concept of memory-dependent derivatives?
Question_8.A: To simplify the numerical calculations in thermoelastic materials
Question_8.B: To provide more insight into the memory effect in physical phenomena
Question_8.C: To study the behavior of magnetic fields in magneto-thermoelastic materials
Question_8.D: To explore the damping of acoustic waves in a magnetic field
Question_8.Source: The motivation for such a new definition is that it provides more insight into the memory effect (the instantaneous change rate depends on the past state) and also better physical meaning.

Question_9.Context: The study discusses the choice of kernel function and time delay parameter in the memory-dependent derivative model.
Question_9.Question: What is the significance of the kernel function in the MDD model?
Question_9.A: It represents the degree of past effect on the present
Question_9.B: It simplifies the numerical calculations in the model
Question_9.C: It determines the rate of change in stress components
Question_9.D: It controls the behavior of temperature distribution
Question_9.Source: The kernel function can be understood as the degree of the past effect on the present.

Question_10.Context: The study presents the method for inverting the Laplace and Fourier transforms to obtain the physical quantities.
Question_10.Question: How is the Laplace transform function inverted to obtain the physical domain solution?
Question_10.B: By replacing s with ω in the Fourier transform
Question_10.C: By evaluating the integral using specific methods
Question_10.D: By using the Fourier inverse transform
Question_10.Source: The method for evaluating this integral is described in Press (1986).
